**Building Condition Assessment - Vancouver**
--------------------------------------------------
### Announcement
The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is inviting proposals for a Building Condition Assessment for one of its real property assets located in Vancouver, British Columbia.

### Project Overview
The purpose of this project is to conduct a Building Condition Assessment for the identified asset, which will provide foundational information on its physical condition. The assessment will help determine the most appropriate management strategy for the retention, maintenance, and/or rehabilitation/renewal of the site, buildings, and building elements.

### Project Details
* **Project Title and Number:** National Research Council Canada Regional Building Condition Assessment (BCA) Program; ID: 22-58115
* **Project Description:** The project involves assessing the physical condition of a single building, located at 4250 Wesbrook Mall, Vancouver, BC V6T 1W5.
* **Duration:** The contract duration is from February 20, 2023, to June 30, 2023.
* **Deliverables:** The successful bidder will be required to provide a comprehensive building condition assessment report, including:
	+ General characteristics of the site, building, and building elements.
	+ History of additions, renovations, or major system improvements.
	+ Condition rating of building elements, such as structure, building envelope, electrical, and mechanical systems.
	+ Comments on maintenance requirements and essential corrective/remedial requirements.
	+ Information on the life-cycle capital cost of refurbishment or replacement of building elements.
	+ Information on the current replacement value (CRV) or replacement cost new (RCN) of each building and its major group elements.
* **Notes:**
	+ Estimated quantity of commodity: 1 building for assessment.
	+ Capital cost plans will be required to be presented on a yearly basis for work over the next 25-year life-cycle of the buildings and elements.

### Tender Information
* **Tender Closing Date:** February 1, 2023, at 5:00 PM EST.
* **Amendment Date:** January 23, 2023.
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** February 20, 2023.
* **Expected Contract End Date:** June 30, 2023.
* **Regions of Opportunity:** British Columbia.
* **Regions of Delivery:** British Columbia.
